title: How to Make Jasmine Ginger Orange Tea

steps.headline: Bring 2-4 cups of water to a boil (however much fits in the teapot).
While the water is boiling, add the loose tea or herbs to the teapot.
Peel the ginger and cut it into 3-6 very thin slices.
Grate the zest off of a clean orange.
steps.description: Make sure to avoid the white pith (it'll make the tea bitter). If you don't have a sharp enough grater, you can carefully peel the zest with a sharp knife. Set aside.

steps.headline: Pour boiling water into the teapot.
Let the tea steep for 3-4 minutes.
Strain out the tea leaves.
steps.description: If you used honeybush, you can leave them in.

steps.headline: Add the ginger, orange zest, and honey.
Let sit for another few minutes before serving.
steps.description: The ginger and orange will continue to impart flavor on the tea as it sits in the teapot.

text: Bring 2-4 cups of water to a boil (however much fits in the teapot).  While the water is boiling, add the loose tea or herbs to the teapot.  Peel the ginger and cut it into 3-6 very thin slices. Set aside. Grate the zest off of a clean orange. Make sure to avoid the white pith (it'll make the tea bitter). If you don't have a sharp enough grater, you can carefully peel the zest with a sharp knife. Set aside. Pour boiling water into the teapot.  Let the tea steep for 3-4 minutes.  Strain out the tea leaves. If you used honeybush, you can leave them in. Add the ginger, orange zest, and honey. Stir. Let sit for another few minutes before serving. The ginger and orange will continue to impart flavor on the tea as it sits in the teapot.
